translation: The Kuma-kāśyapa-sūtra in one volume (a child-kāśyapa-saṃdhinirmocana-sūtra) was a translation of a lost sūtra in the Saṃyuktâgama records (the Fajing records say it came from the 16th volume of the Middle Length Āgama, a variant translation), the Boy-kāśyapa-saṃdhinirmocana-sūtra in one volume (also called the Child-kāśyapa-sūtra), and the Kivuqin śramaṇa-saṃdhinirmocana-sūtra (the Fang records say it was the same as the Rāsh-kāśyapa-sūtra, the Shishu-no-kāśyapa-sūtra), both of which were translations of the same text.

source_sentence: 其本並闕。
translation: The original is missing.

translation: One volume of the Sutra of the Six Vows (a translation of the Sutra of the Six Vows by Śṛgālavādas, also known as the Sutra of the Six Vows) was translated by the Western Jin dynasty Tripiṭaka master Zhu Fahui.

translation: Six Fascicle (or Five or Eight Fascicle) Sutra of Lohan Translated by Zhu Fahou, a Tripiṭaka of the Western Jìn Dynasty (First Translation) Eight Fascicle Sutra of Lohan Translated by Shi Fajiao, an ascetic of the Western Jìn Dynasty (Third Translation) Right and the Fourth Fascicle of the Longer Āgama, Middle Length Sutra of the Record of the World.

translation: One volume of the Sutra of the Six Worshipers of Weige-Chief (also called Weihua) was translated by the Western Tripiṭaka of the Eastern Jin dynasty, Jitoumi (second translation); one volume of the Sutra of the Six Worshipers of Weige-Chief was translated by the Householder Zhu Nandi of the Eastern Jin dynasty (third translation); and one volume of the Sutra of the Son of Shangsheng (also called Xicheng liuxiang bai jing) was translated by the Song ascetic Shihuijian (fourth translation) to the right and the Sutra of Shangsheng in the Thirty-third Central Canon.

translation: One volume of the Sutra of Joyful Delight (recorded in the Dharma-sūtra as Exhortation to Delight, out of the twelfth book of the Middle Length Āgamas), one volume of the Sutra on the Buddha's Five Hundred Bhikṣus (recorded in the Western Jin dynasty), one volume of the Classical Sutra of An Gong (recorded in the Han dynasty), and one volume of the Classical Sutra of An Gong (recorded in the Han dynasty), in which the Buddha admonished the bhikṣus, saying, "With the divine eye, I examine the birth and death of all people under heaven, the good and ugly, the venerable and the inferior.

translation: The other five sūtras are not reprinted in the record.

translation: An Gong said.

translation: It's one of four kinds of Āgamas and doesn't refer to any particular one.

source_sentence: 並是梁僧祐錄中新集失譯經(今附宋錄)。
translation: They are also the new collection of lost scriptures from the Liang Sengyou Catalogue (now appended to the Song Catalogue).

source_sentence: 從頂生王因緣經下諸失譯經。
translation: From the Tingshengwang yinnian jing down to the other lost sūtras.

source_sentence: 群錄之中但題名目久虧其本無可披尋。
translation: Among the various records, there are only titles and headings that have been missing for a long time, and the origin is untraceable.

source_sentence: 大小二乘實難詮定。
translation: It's really difficult to define the two vehicles as large or small.

source_sentence: 且粗分判尚多參涉幸諸明士詳而正之。
translation: It's fortunate that there's still much to be learned from this rough classification, but I'm grateful for the insight of those who have corrected it in detail.

source_sentence: 小乘律闕本三十七部四十二卷
translation: Thirty-seven sections and forty-two volumes of the lesser vehicle vinaya are missing.

source_sentence: 僧祇戒本一卷曹魏天竺沙門曇柯迦羅譯(第一譯)右前後兩譯一本在藏一本闕。
translation: (1) Saṃgha-bhikṣu-prātimokṣa-sūtra: one volume (the first translation); the two translations preceding and following the right one are in the canon and the other is missing.

source_sentence: 十誦比丘戒本一卷(或云十誦大比丘戒)苻秦西域沙門曇摩持共竺佛念譯(第一譯)十誦比丘戒本一卷東晉西域沙門竺曇無蘭合出(第二譯右長房錄云太元六年曇無蘭合僧純曇摩持竺僧舒三家本以為一卷見寶唱錄謹按群錄僧純於拘夷國得十誦尼戒梵本將來令曇摩持等譯出唯此僧純與曇摩持同是一本其竺僧舒群錄無名不知合本從何而得未詳所以)右兼合本前後三譯一存二闕。
translation: 十誦比丘戒本一卷(或云十誦大比丘戒)苻秦西域沙門曇摩持共竺佛念譯(第一譯)十誦比丘戒本一卷東晉西域沙門竺曇無蘭合出(第二譯右長房錄云太元六年曇無蘭合僧純曇摩持竺僧舒三家本以為一卷見寶唱錄謹按群錄僧純於拘夷國得十誦尼戒梵本將來令曇摩持等譯出唯此僧純與曇摩持同是一本其竺僧舒群錄無名不知合本從何而得未詳所以)右兼合本前後三譯一存二闕。

translation: One volume of the Mahābhikṣuṇī Precepts (or the Mahābhikṣuṇī Precepts Sutra out of the Ten Recitations Vinaya) translated by the Western Jin Tripiṭaka Zhu Faju (first translation) One volume of the Mahābhikṣuṇī Precepts (also called the Ten Recitations Mahābhikṣuṇī Precepts) translated by the Śākyamuni and Dharmachi of the Western Regions of the Fuqin together with the translation by Fonian (second translation) One volume of the Ten Recitations Mahābhikṣuṇī Precepts produced by the Liangzhou Śākyamuni Zhu Fonian (third translation) (right Changfang's Record says that Sengsun obtained the Sanskrit version of the Fonian Vinaya in the country of Kauśī and later Zhu Fadai deleted and corrected it as shown in the Baochang Record.)

source_sentence: 前後三譯其本並闕。
translation: The three previous and subsequent translations of the Mahāyāna scriptures are missing from the original.

source_sentence: 彌沙塞羯磨一卷(出彌沙塞律)宋罽賓三藏佛陀什等譯(單本)彌沙塞律抄一卷師子國沙門僧伽跋彌譯(不知年代出寶唱錄單本附宋)迦葉禁戒經一卷(一名摩訶比丘經一名真偽沙門經)東晉沙門釋退公譯(第一譯)右前後兩譯一存一闕。
translation: One volume of the Mahāsaka-prātimokṣa-sūtra (a translation of the Mahāsaka-prātimokṣa-sūtra) by the Song dynasty monk Buddhasiṃha (a single copy), one volume of the Mahāsaka-prātimokṣa-sūtra (a translation of the first translation), and one of the two translations preceding and following it, one of which is extant and one of which is missing.

source_sentence: 優婆塞五戒經一卷(一名五相經)宋居士沮渠京聲譯(第二譯)右前後兩譯。
translation: Upāsaka Five Precepts Sutra One Volume (A Sutra on the Five Marks) Translated by Juequ Jingsheng, a Song householder (second translation).

source_sentence: 一存一闕。
translation: One is extant and one is missing.

source_sentence: 後秦曇摩蜱譯十誦律。
translation: In the late Qin Dynasty, Dharmarakṣa translated the Ten Recitations Vinaya.

source_sentence: 譯雜事問二卷。
translation: It is a two-volume translation of the Questions on Miscellaneous Matters.

source_sentence: 寶唱錄云。
translation: Baoxing's Record says.

source_sentence: 後秦罽賓沙門曇摩耶舍譯十誦律雜事一卷。
translation: The Latter Qín Śākyamuni Dharmayaśas translated the Ten Recitations Vinaya into one volume of miscellaneous matters.

source_sentence: 此之二說多是錄家人名差誤。
translation: Most of these two sayings are errors in the names of the recorded authors.

source_sentence: 或即是前第一譯者。
translation: Perhaps they were the first translation.

source_sentence: 長房內典二錄並云東晉所翻。
translation: The two records in the Changfang neijing canon also say that they were translated in the Eastern Jin dynasty.

source_sentence: 非秦代譯。
translation: They weren't translated in the Qin Dynasty.

source_sentence: 依此二錄為正。
translation: Relying on these two records is correct.

source_sentence: 房錄又云曇摩譯者明佛法僧物互相交涉分齊差殊甚要須善防護。
translation: The Tang Register also says that the Tanmo translator explained that the mutual interactions of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha are so disparate that they must be well guarded.

source_sentence: 今藏中有五百問事經一卷有三十三紙亦明佛法僧物不得參涉。
translation: In the present collection, there's a sutra of five hundred questions in one volume with thirty-three pages that also explains that the Buddha, Dharma, and saṃgha must not be involved with each other.

source_sentence: 事然名目不同莫知所以。
translation: These matters, however, have different names, and it's hard to know why.

source_sentence: 餘錄云出十誦律者即五百問經中明三十九夜受日等事。
translation: The other records say that those who recite the Vinaya out of the Five Hundred Questions sūtra also state that the thirty-nine nights receive the sun and other matters.

source_sentence: 即與十誦符同。
translation: That's the same as the ten recitations.

source_sentence: 但以名目有殊。
translation: However, there's a difference in name and title.

source_sentence: 未為尅定。
translation: It's not yet set in stone.

source_sentence: 後諸博見詳而正之)。
translation: (Later, those who learned more will see it in detail and correct it.)
